6.author: Chris B

text: Rule 204 is invalid. A transmutation is a rule change as stipulated in 103 and 111 , 111 says rule changes which are transmutations are adopted by unanimous vote. Rule 204 says rule changes are adopted by unanimous vote currently but after the second circuit of turns changes to simple majority. This has effected my method of play. Therefore by judges decision yesterday these are in conflict. By judges decision yesterday 204 is 'entirely void'.
8.author: Alex W

text: Given that Proposition 308 does not seem to be a valid amendment according to the linked judgement, has a valid rule-change been made this day? In particular, may the proposal still be adopted and points modified as a consequence of the vote?

text: Can rules be "in conflict" (Rule  only at the point of use? Or are rules in conflict if there is a situation where they will come to contradict each other over the course of play. Furthermore, if I adjust my play due to the presence of certain rules that may come to contradict each other, have they already come "into conflict" given that they have both influenced my play over said issue?
